code:
# @param {String[]} words
# @return {Integer}
def minimize_concatenated_length(words)
  return words[0].length if words.length == 1
  
  # Initialize the dp array to store the minimum length after joining i words
  dp = Array.new(words.length) { Array.new(2, Float::INFINITY) }
  
  # Base case: Only one word
  dp[0][0] = words[0].length
  dp[0][1] = words[0].length
  
  # Iterate through words to fill dp array
  (1...words.length).each do |i|
    (0...i).each do |j|
      # Case 1: Join current word to the end of the previous sequence
      if words[j][-1] == words[i][0]
        dp[i][0] = [dp[i][0], dp[j][0] + words[i].length - 1].min
      else
        dp[i][0] = [dp[i][0], dp[j][0] + words[i].length].min
      end
      
      # Case 2: Join current word to the start of the previous sequence
      if words[i][-1] == words[j][0]
        dp[i][1] = [dp[i][1], dp[j][1] + words[i].length - 1].min
      else
        dp[i][1] = [dp[i][1], dp[j][1] + words[i].length].min
      end
    end
  end
  
  # The answer is the minimum length after joining all words
  [dp.last[0], dp.last[1]].min
end
